definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc

sentences.english: The bleakness is with strong red and green background, dispersing after a grand feast.
sentences.chinese: 這是一片大紅大綠襯托出的蒼涼，盛宴後的散席。

sentences.english: Ate not to know how long, finally scatter a seat on the entire.
sentences.chinese: 吃了不知多久，最後總算散席了。

sentences.english: After dinner, the master wants to accompany thevisitor to chat a while, but not suitable too is long.
sentences.chinese: 散席後，主人要陪客人閒聊一會兒，但不宜太久。

definition: to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
to disperse after a happy time (idiom)/everyone enjoys themselves to the full then party breaks up
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to absent oneself from a meeting/to decline to attend
(of a theater) to empty/(of a show) to end
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
food and drink/food to accompany wine
